intro: Micranthes petiolaris var. shealyi, commonly known as Shealy's narrowleaf toothcup, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and toothed, with a distinctive basal rosette structure. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing small, yellowish-white blooms that attract pollinators.
